creditline: On Loan from the Santa Barbara Museum of Art, Gift of Mrs. Max Schott
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: mask with metal facial features and crescent moon shaped head piece on triangular body; wood base
text: Imagine this reliquary guardian as it once was, fastened to a basket containing the things it was supposed to guard: the bones of important ancestors. Its shiny copper sheets, of local and European origin, would have beautifully varied from yellow to brown to red. But they were not merely aesthetic. They were designed to please the ancestors and deflect—like a mirror—negative influences.
title: Reliquary figure
